symptoms: Dark brown to black spots on leaves and fruit.
treatment: Apply fungicides like myclobutanil or captan at early leaf stages.
best_practices: Plant resistant apple varieties, prune for better air circulation, remove fallen leaves.

symptoms: Dark lesions on leaves, rapid decay of tubers, white fungal growth under humid conditions.
treatment: Use fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
best_practices: Avoid overhead irrigation, rotate crops every 3 years.

symptoms: Small, dark brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves.
treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides at first signs of disease.
best_practices: Remove infected leaves, ensure good spacing for airflow.

symptoms: Large, dark green blotches on leaves that rapidly turn brown.
treatment: Use fungicides containing chlorothalonil or copper hydroxide.
best_practices: Avoid overhead watering, use resistant varieties.

symptoms: White, powdery spots on leaves and fruit, causing leaf distortion.
treatment: Apply sulfur or neem oil sprays regularly.
best_practices: Improve air circulation, remove infected leaves.

symptoms: Long, rectangular, grayish-brown lesions on leaves.
treatment: Use fungicides containing strobilurin at early infection stage.
best_practices: Rotate crops, remove infected crop residues.

symptoms: Small, reddish-brown pustules on underside of leaves.
treatment: Apply triazole or strobilurin fungicides every 7-10 days.
best_practices: Plant resistant varieties, use proper spacing.

symptoms: Small, orange pustules on leaves leading to defoliation.
treatment: Use triazole-based fungicides when symptoms appear.
best_practices: Rotate wheat with non-host crops, remove crop debris.

symptoms: Yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces, black mold underneath.
treatment: Use fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
best_practices: Ensure good air circulation, avoid overhead watering.

symptoms: Purple spots on leaves that expand and turn brown.
best_practices: Water at the base, remove infected leaves.
source: University of California Small Farms Program

symptoms: Elongated, grayish lesions on leaves, leading to leaf death.
best_practices: Avoid high nitrogen fertilization, use resistant varieties.

symptoms: Leaves curl, thicken, and turn red or purple.
treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides in dormant season.
best_practices: Prune affected branches, plant resistant varieties.

symptoms: Yellow V-shaped lesions on leaf edges, black veins.
best_practices: Rotate crops, avoid water splashing on leaves.
source: North Carolina State University Plant Pathology

symptoms: Small, dark lesions with yellow halos on leaves and fruit.
best_practices: Space plants properly, avoid overhead watering.

symptoms: Dark, sunken spots on fruit, flowers, and leaves.
best_practices: Harvest fruits early, avoid humid storage conditions.

symptoms: Brown, sunken lesions on young leaves.
treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides at first sign.
best_practices: Prune affected leaves, maintain proper humidity.

symptoms: Sudden wilting of plants, yellowing leaves.
